item.title: 2st Law of behavior change
item.description: 2st law: Make it attractive We humans are prone to liking exaggerated versions of reality, for example, junk food. One of the main goals of food science is to make products more appealing to consumers. Not only that, look around: pornography with stimulating scenes at a rate is impossible to produce in real life; Social media offers more like and compliments than you get for your work; photo editing, advertising, fashion (not even the model looks like herself in the final image); Catchy titles, etc.

item.title: 1st law of behavior change
item.description: Make it clear for good habits, make it invisible for bad habits Before delving into the techniques, understand: your habits become automatic and end up being unconscious actions. In other words, you don’t need to be aware of the stimulus for the habit to begin. This is what makes habits useful and dangerous. Before building new habits, you must be aware of your current ones. Point and talk: Method used by Japan to reduce errors.
